content.question:
A researcher claims that different enzymes exhibit maximal function over different <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ranges. To test the claim, the researcher carries out an experiment that includes three different enzymes: pepsin, salivary amylase, and arginase. The results of the experiment are represented in Figure 1.

Figure 1. The effect of <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on three different enzymes

Which of the following actions will provide the most appropriate negative control for the experiment?

choices.label: Repeating the experiment with a fourth enzyme
Repeating the experiment at several different temperatures
Repeating the experiment with denatured enzymes
Repeating the experiment using several different methods for measuring <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Repeating the experiment with denatured enzymes
